013package org.apache.juneau.html;

015import static org.apache.juneau.collections.JsonMap.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.ThrowableUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;

021import java.nio.charset.*;
022import java.util.*;
023import java.util.function.*;
024import java.util.regex.*;

026import org.apache.juneau.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;

030import org.apache.juneau.svl.*;

034/**
035 * Serializes POJOs to HTTP responses as HTML documents.
036 *
037 * <h5 class='topic'>Media types</h5>
038 * <p>
039 * Handles <c>Accept</c> types:  <bc>text/html</bc>
040 * <p>
041 * Produces <c>Content-Type</c> types:  <bc>text/html</bc>
042 *
043 * <h5 class='topic'>Description</h5>
044 * <p>
045 * Same as {@link HtmlSerializer}, except wraps the response in <code><xt>&lt;html&gt;</code>,
046 * <code><xt>&lt;head&gt;</code>, and <code><xt>&lt;body&gt;</code> tags so that it can be rendered in a browser.
047 *
048 * <p>
049 * Configurable properties are typically specified via <ja>@HtmlDocConfig</ja>.
050 *
051 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
052 * <p class='bjava'>
053 *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(
054 *       messages=<js>"nls/AddressBookResource"</js>,
055 *       title=<js>"$L{title}"</js>,
056 *       description=<js>"$L{description}"</js>
057 *    )
058 *    <ja>@HtmlDocConfig</ja>(
059 *       navlinks={
060 *          <js>"api: servlet:/api"</js>,
061 *          <js>"doc: doc"</js>
062 *       }
063 *    )
064 *    <jk>public class</jk> AddressBookResource <jk>extends</jk> BasicRestServlet {
065 * </p>
066 *
067 * <p>
068 * The <c>$L{...}</c> variable represent localized strings pulled from the resource bundle identified by the
069 * <c>messages</c> annotation.
070 * <br>These variables are replaced at runtime based on the HTTP request locale.
071 * <br>Several built-in runtime variable types are defined, and the API can be extended to include user-defined variables.
072 *
073 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
074 *    <li class='note'>This class is thread safe and reusable.
075 * </ul>
076 *
077 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
078 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../index.html#jm.HtmlDetails">HTML Details</a>
079
080 * </ul>
081 */
082public class HtmlDocSerializer extends HtmlStrippedDocSerializer {
083
084   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
085   // Static
086   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
087
088   private static final String[] EMPTY_ARRAY = {};
089
090   /** Default serializer, all default settings. */
091   public static final HtmlDocSerializer DEFAULT = new HtmlDocSerializer(create());
092
093   /**
094    * Creates a new builder for this object.
095    *
096    * @return A new builder.
097    */
098   public static Builder create() {
099      return new Builder();
100   }
101
102   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
103   // Builder
104   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
105
106   /**
107    * Builder class.
108    */
109   @FluentSetters
110   public static class Builder extends HtmlStrippedDocSerializer.Builder {
111
112      private static final Cache<HashKey,HtmlDocSerializer> CACHE = Cache.of(HashKey.class, HtmlDocSerializer.class).build();
113
114      List<String> aside, footer, head, header, nav, navlinks, script, style, stylesheet;
115      AsideFloat asideFloat;
116      String noResultsMessage;
117      boolean nowrap, resolveBodyVars;
118      Class<? extends HtmlDocTemplate> template;
119      List<Class<? extends HtmlWidget>> widgets;
120
121      /**
122       * Constructor, default settings.
123       */
124      protected Builder() {
125         produces("text/html");
126         accept("text/html");
127         asideFloat = AsideFloat.RIGHT;
128         noResultsMessage = "<p>no results</p>";
129         template = BasicHtmlDocTemplate.class;
130      }
131
132      /**
133       * Copy constructor.
134       *
135       * @param copyFrom The bean to copy from.
136       */
137      protected Builder(HtmlDocSerializer copyFrom) {
138         super(copyFrom);
139         aside = copy(copyFrom.aside);
140         footer = copy(copyFrom.footer);
141         head = copy(copyFrom.head);
142         header = copy(copyFrom.header);
143         nav = copy(copyFrom.nav);
144         navlinks = copy(copyFrom.navlinks);
145         script = copy(copyFrom.script);
146         style = copy(copyFrom.style);
147         stylesheet = copy(copyFrom.stylesheet);
148         asideFloat = copyFrom.asideFloat;
149         noResultsMessage = copyFrom.noResultsMessage;
150         nowrap = copyFrom.nowrap;
151         resolveBodyVars = copyFrom.resolveBodyVars;
152         template = copyFrom.template;
153         widgets = copy(copyFrom.widgets);
154      }
155
156      /**
157       * Copy constructor.
158       *
159       * @param copyFrom The builder to copy from.
160       */
161      protected Builder(Builder copyFrom) {
162         super(copyFrom);
163         aside = copy(copyFrom.aside);
164         footer = copy(copyFrom.footer);
165         head = copy(copyFrom.head);
166         header = copy(copyFrom.header);
167         nav = copy(copyFrom.nav);
168         navlinks = copy(copyFrom.navlinks);
169         script = copy(copyFrom.script);
170         style = copy(copyFrom.style);
171         stylesheet = copy(copyFrom.stylesheet);
172         asideFloat = copyFrom.asideFloat;
173         noResultsMessage = copyFrom.noResultsMessage;
174         nowrap = copyFrom.nowrap;
175         resolveBodyVars = copyFrom.resolveBodyVars;
176         template = copyFrom.template;
177         widgets = copy(copyFrom.widgets);
178      }
179
180      @Override /* Context.Builder */
181      public Builder copy() {
182         return new Builder(this);
183      }
184
185      @Override /* Context.Builder */
186      public HtmlDocSerializer build() {
187         return cache(CACHE).build(HtmlDocSerializer.class);
188      }
189
190      @Override /* Context.Builder */
191      public HashKey hashKey() {
192         return HashKey.of(
193            super.hashKey(),
194            aside,
195            footer,
196            head,
197            header,
198            nav,
199            navlinks,
200            script,
201            style,
202            stylesheet,
203            asideFloat,
204            noResultsMessage,
205            nowrap,
206            resolveBodyVars,
207            template,
208            widgets
209         );
210      }
211
212      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
213      // Properties
214      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
215
216      /**
217       * Aside section contents.
218       *
219       * <p>
220       * Allows you to specify the contents of the aside section on the HTML page.
221       * The aside section floats on the right of the page for providing content supporting the serialized content of
222       * the page.
223       *
224       * <p>
225       * By default, the aside section is empty.
226       *
227       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
228       * <p class='bjava'>
229       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
230       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
231       *       .aside(
232       *          <js>"&lt;ul&gt;"</js>,
233       *          <js>" &lt;li&gt;Item 1"</js>,
234       *          <js>" &lt;li&gt;Item 2"</js>,
235       *          <js>" &lt;li&gt;Item 3"</js>,
236       *          <js>"&lt;/ul&gt;"</js>
237       *       )
238       *       .build();
239       * </p>
240       *
241       * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
242       *    <li class='note'>
243       *       Format: HTML
244       *    <li class='note'>
245       *       Supports <a class="doclink" href="../../../../index.html#jrs.SvlVariables">SVL Variables</a>
246       *       (e.g. <js>"$L{my.localized.variable}"</js>).
247       *    <li class='note'>
248       *       A value of <js>"NONE"</js> can be used to force no value.
249       *    <li class='note'>
250       *       The parent value can be included by adding the literal <js>"INHERIT"</js> as a value.
251       *    <li class='note'>
252       *       Multiple values are combined with newlines into a single string.
253       *    <li class='note'>
254       *       On methods, this value is inherited from the <ja>@HtmlDocConfig</ja> annotation on the servlet/resource class.
255       *    <li class='note'>
256       *       On servlet/resource classes, this value is inherited from the <ja>@HtmlDocConfig</ja> annotation on the
257       *       parent class.
258       * </ul>
259       *
260       * @param value
261       *    The new value for this property.
262       * @return This object.
263       */
264      @FluentSetter
265      public Builder aside(String...value) {
266         aside = merge(aside, value);
267         return this;
268      }
269
270      /**
271       * Returns the list of aside section contents.
272       *
273       * <p>
274       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #aside(String...)}.
275       *
276       * @return The list of aside section contents.
277       * @see #aside(String...)
278       */
279      public List<String> aside() {
280         if (aside == null)
281            aside = list();
282         return aside;
283      }
284
285      /**
286       * Float aside section contents.
287       *
288       * <p>
289       * Allows you to position the aside contents of the page around the main contents.
290       *
291       * <p>
292       * By default, the aside section is floated to the right.
293       *
294       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
295       * <p class='bjava'>
296       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
297       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
298       *       .aside(
299       *          <js>"&lt;ul&gt;"</js>,
300       *          <js>" &lt;li&gt;Item 1"</js>,
301       *          <js>" &lt;li&gt;Item 2"</js>,
302       *          <js>" &lt;li&gt;Item 3"</js>,
303       *          <js>"&lt;/ul&gt;"</js>
304       *       )
305       *       .asideFloat(<jsf>RIGHT</jsf>)
306       *       .build();
307       * </p>
308       *
309       * @param value
310       *    The new value for this property.
311       * @return This object.
312       */
313      @FluentSetter
314      public Builder asideFloat(AsideFloat value) {
315         asideFloat = value;
316         return this;
317      }
318
319      /**
320       * Footer section contents.
321       *
322       * <p>
323       * Allows you to specify the contents of the footer section on the HTML page.
324       *
325       * <p>
326       * By default, the footer section is empty.
327       *
328       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
329       * <p class='bjava'>
330       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
331       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
332       *       .footer(
333       *          <js>"&lt;b&gt;This interface is great!&lt;/b&gt;"</js>
334       *       )
335       *       .build();
336       * </p>
337       *
338       * @param value
339       *    The new value for this property.
340       * @return This object.
341       */
342      @FluentSetter
343      public Builder footer(String...value) {
344         footer = merge(footer, value);
345         return this;
346      }
347
348      /**
349       * Returns the list of footer section contents.
350       *
351       * <p>
352       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #footer(String...)}.
353       *
354       * @return The list of footer section contents.
355       * @see #footer(String...)
356       */
357      public List<String> footer() {
358         if (footer == null)
359            footer = list();
360         return footer;
361      }
362
363      /**
364       * Additional head section content.
365       *
366       * <p>
367       * Adds the specified HTML content to the head section of the page.
368       *
369       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
370       * <p class='bjava'>
371       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
372       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
373       *       .head(
374       *          <js>"&lt;link rel='icon' href='$U{servlet:/htdocs/mypageicon.ico}'&gt;"</js>
375       *       )
376       *       .build();
377       * </p>
378       *
379       * @param value
380       *    The new value for this property.
381       * @return This object.
382       */
383      @FluentSetter
384      public Builder head(String...value) {
385         head = merge(head, value);
386         return this;
387      }
388
389      /**
390       * Returns the list of head section contents.
391       *
392       * <p>
393       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #head(String...)}.
394       *
395       * @return The list of head section contents.
396       * @see #head(String...)
397       */
398      public List<String> head() {
399         if (head == null)
400            head = list();
401         return head;
402      }
403
404      /**
405       * Header section contents.
406       *
407       * <p>
408       * Allows you to override the contents of the header section on the HTML page.
409       * The header section normally contains the title and description at the top of the page.
410       *
411       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
412       * <p class='bjava'>
413       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
414       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
415       *       .header(
416       *          <js>"&lt;h1&gt;My own header&lt;/h1&gt;"</js>
417       *       )
418       *       .build()
419       * </p>
420       *
421       * @param value
422       *    The new value for this property.
423       * @return This object.
424       */
425      @FluentSetter
426      public Builder header(String...value) {
427         header = merge(header, value);
428         return this;
429      }
430
431      /**
432       * Returns the list of header section contents.
433       *
434       * <p>
435       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #header(String...)}.
436       *
437       * @return The list of header section contents.
438       * @see #header(String...)
439       */
440      public List<String> header() {
441         if (header == null)
442            header = list();
443         return header;
444      }
445
446      /**
447       * Nav section contents.
448       *
449       * <p>
450       * Allows you to override the contents of the nav section on the HTML page.
451       * The nav section normally contains the page links at the top of the page.
452       *
453       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
454       * <p class='bjava'>
455       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
456       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
457       *       .nav(
458       *          <js>"&lt;p class='special-navigation'&gt;This is my special navigation content&lt;/p&gt;"</js>
459       *       )
460       *       .build()
461       * </p>
462       *
463       * <p>
464       * When this property is specified, the {@link Builder#navlinks(String...)} property is ignored.
465       *
466       * @param value
467       *    The new value for this property.
468       * @return This object.
469       */
470      @FluentSetter
471      public Builder nav(String...value) {
472         nav = merge(nav, value);
473         return this;
474      }
475
476      /**
477       * Returns the list of nav section contents.
478       *
479       * <p>
480       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #nav(String...)}.
481       *
482       * @return The list of nav section contents.
483       * @see #nav(String...)
484       */
485      public List<String> nav() {
486         if (nav == null)
487            nav = list();
488         return nav;
489      }
490
491      /**
492       * Page navigation links.
493       *
494       * <p>
495       * Adds a list of hyperlinks immediately under the title and description but above the content of the page.
496       *
497       * <p>
498       * This can be used to provide convenient hyperlinks when viewing the REST interface from a browser.
499       *
500       * <p>
501       * The value is an array of strings with two possible values:
502       * <ul>
503       *    <li>A key-value pair representing a hyperlink label and href:
504       *       <br><js>"google: http://google.com"</js>
505       *    <li>Arbitrary HTML.
506       * </ul>
507       *
508       * <p>
509       * Relative URLs are considered relative to the servlet path.
510       * For example, if the servlet path is <js>"http://localhost/myContext/myServlet"</js>, and the
511       * URL is <js>"foo"</js>, the link becomes <js>"http://localhost/myContext/myServlet/foo"</js>.
512       * Absolute (<js>"/myOtherContext/foo"</js>) and fully-qualified (<js>"http://localhost2/foo"</js>) URLs
513       * can also be used in addition to various other protocols specified by {@link UriResolver} such as
514       * <js>"servlet:/..."</js>.
515       *
516       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
517       * <p class='bjava'>
518       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
519       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
520       *       .navlinks(
521       *          <js>"api: servlet:/api"</js>,
522       *          <js>"stats: servlet:/stats"</js>,
523       *          <js>"doc: doc"</js>
524       *       )
525       *       .build();
526       * </p>
527       *
528       * @param value
529       *    The new value for this property.
530       * @return This object.
531       */
532      @FluentSetter
533      public Builder navlinks(String...value) {
534         navlinks = mergeNavLinks(navlinks, value);
535         return this;
536      }
537
538      /**
539       * Returns the list of navlinks section contents.
540       *
541       * <p>
542       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #navlinks(String...)}.
543       *
544       * @return The list of navlinks section contents.
545       * @see #navlinks(String...)
546       */
547      public List<String> navlinks() {
548         if (navlinks == null)
549            navlinks = list();
550         return navlinks;
551      }
552
553      /**
554       * No-results message.
555       *
556       * <p>
557       * Allows you to specify the string message used when trying to serialize an empty array or empty list.
558       *
559       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
560       * <p class='bjava'>
561       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
562       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
563       *       .noResultsMessage(<js>"&lt;b&gt;This interface is great!&lt;/b&gt;"</js>)
564       *       .build();
565       * </p>
566       *
567       * <p>
568       * A value of <js>"NONE"</js> can be used to represent no value to differentiate it from an empty string.
569       *
570       * @param value
571       *    The new value for this property.
572       * @return This object.
573       */
574      @FluentSetter
575      public Builder noResultsMessage(String value) {
576         noResultsMessage = value;
577         return this;
578      }
579
580      /**
581       * Prevent word wrap on page.
582       *
583       * <p>
584       * Adds <js>"* {white-space:nowrap}"</js> to the CSS instructions on the page to prevent word wrapping.
585       *
586       * @return This object.
587       */
588      @FluentSetter
589      public Builder nowrap() {
590         return nowrap(true);
591      }
592
593      /**
594       * Same as {@link #nowrap()} but allows you to explicitly specify the boolean value.
595       *
596       * @param value
597       *    The new value for this property.
598       * @return This object.
599       * @see #nowrap()
600       */
601      @FluentSetter
602      public Builder nowrap(boolean value) {
603         nowrap = value;
604         return this;
605      }
606
607      /**
608       * Resolve $ variables in serialized POJO.
609       *
610       * @return This object.
611       */
612      @FluentSetter
613      public Builder resolveBodyVars() {
614         return resolveBodyVars(true);
615      }
616
617      /**
618       * Same as {@link #resolveBodyVars()} but allows you to explicitly specify the boolean value.
619       *
620       * @param value
621       *    The new value for this property.
622       * @return This object.
623       * @see #nowrap()
624       */
625      @FluentSetter
626      public Builder resolveBodyVars(boolean value) {
627         resolveBodyVars = value;
628         return this;
629      }

631      /**
632       * Adds the specified Javascript code to the HTML page.
633       *
634       * <p>
635       * A shortcut on <ja>@Rest</ja> is also provided for this setting:
636       * <p class='bjava'>
637       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
638       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
639       *       .script(<js>"alert('hello!');"</js>)
640       *       .build();
641       * </p>
642       *
643       * @param value
644       *    The value to add to this property.
645       * @return This object.
646       */
647      @FluentSetter
648      public Builder script(String...value) {
649         script = merge(script, value);
650         return this;
651      }
652
653      /**
654       * Returns the list of page script contents.
655       *
656       * <p>
657       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #script(String...)}.
658       *
659       * @return The list of page script contents.
660       * @see #script(String...)
661       */
662      public List<String> script() {
663         if (script == null)
664            script = list();
665         return script;
666      }
667
668      /**
669       * Adds the specified CSS instructions to the HTML page.
670       *
671       * <p class='bjava'>
672       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
673       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
674       *       .style(
675       *          <js>"h3 { color: red; }"</js>,
676       *          <js>"h5 { font-weight: bold; }"</js>
677       *       )
678       *       .build();
679       * </p>
680       *
681       * @param value
682       *    The value to add to this property.
683       * @return This object.
684       */
685      @FluentSetter
686      public Builder style(String...value) {
687         style = merge(style, value);
688         return this;
689      }
690
691      /**
692       * Returns the list of page style contents.
693       *
694       * <p>

696       *

699       */
700      public List<String> style() {
701         if (style == null)
702            style = list();

706      /**
707       * Adds to the list of stylesheet URLs.
708       *
709       * <p>

711       *
712       * @param value
713       *    The value to add to this property.
714       * @return This object.
715       */
716      @FluentSetter
717      public Builder stylesheet(String...value) {

719         return this;
720      }

722      /**
723       * Returns the list of stylesheet URLs.
724       *
725       * <p>
726       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #stylesheet(String...)}.
727       *
728       * @return The list of stylesheet URLs.
729       * @see #stylesheet(String...)
730       */
731      public List<String> stylesheet() {
732         if (stylesheet == null)
733            stylesheet = list();
734         return stylesheet;
735      }
736
737      /**
738       * HTML document template.
739       *
740       * <p>
741       * Specifies the template to use for serializing the page.
742       *
743       * <p>
744       * By default, the {@link BasicHtmlDocTemplate} class is used to construct the contents of the HTML page, but
745       * can be overridden with your own custom implementation class.
746       *
747       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
748       * <p class='bjava'>
749       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
750       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
751       *       .template(MySpecialDocTemplate.<jk>class</jk>)
752       *       .build();
753       * </p>
754       *
755       * @param value
756       *    The new value for this property.
757       * @return This object.
758       */
759      @FluentSetter
760      public Builder template(Class<? extends HtmlDocTemplate> value) {
761         template = value;
762         return this;
763      }
764
765      /**
766       * HTML Widgets.
767       *
768       * <p>
769       * Defines widgets that can be used in conjunction with string variables of the form <js>"$W{name}"</js>to quickly
770       * generate arbitrary replacement text.
771       *
772       * Widgets resolve the following variables:
773       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
774       *    <li><js>"$W{name}"</js> - Contents returned by {@link HtmlWidget#getHtml(VarResolverSession)}.
775       *    <li><js>"$W{name.script}"</js> - Contents returned by {@link HtmlWidget#getScript(VarResolverSession)}.
776       *       <br>The script contents are automatically inserted into the <xt>&lt;head/script&gt;</xt> section
777       *           in the HTML page.
778       *    <li><js>"$W{name.style}"</js> - Contents returned by {@link HtmlWidget#getStyle(VarResolverSession)}.
779       *       <br>The styles contents are automatically inserted into the <xt>&lt;head/style&gt;</xt> section
780       *           in the HTML page.
781       * </ul>
782       *
783       * <p>
784       * The following examples shows how to associate a widget with a REST method and then have it rendered in the links
785       * and aside section of the page:
786       *
787       * <p class='bjava'>
788       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = HtmlDocSerializer
789       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
790       *       .widgets(
791       *          MyWidget.<jk>class</jk>
792       *       )
793       *       .navlinks(
794       *          <js>"$W{MyWidget}"</js>
795       *       )
796       *       .aside(
797       *          <js>"Check out this widget:  $W{MyWidget}"</js>
798       *       )
799       *       .build();
800       * </p>
801       *
802       * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
803       *    <li class='note'>
804       *       Widgets are inherited from super classes, but can be overridden by reusing the widget name.
805       * </ul>
806       *
807       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
808       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../index.html#jrs.HtmlWidgets">Widgets</a>
809       * </ul>
810       *
811       * @param values The values to add to this setting.
812       * @return This object.
813       */
814      @FluentSetter
815      @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
816      public Builder widgets(Class<? extends HtmlWidget>...values) {
817         addAll(widgets(), values);
818         return this;
819      }
820
821      /**
822       * Returns the list of page widgets.
823       *
824       * <p>
825       * Gives access to the inner list if you need to make more than simple additions via {@link #widgets(Class...)}.
826       *
827       * @return The list of page widgets.
828       * @see #widgets(Class...)
829       */
830      public List<Class<? extends HtmlWidget>> widgets() {
831         if (widgets == null)
832            widgets = list();
833         return widgets;
834      }
835

1608      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1609      // Helpers
1610      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1611
1612      private static <T> List<T> copy(List<T> s) {
1613         return s == null || s.isEmpty() ? null : copyOf(s);
1614      }
1615
1616      private static <T> List<T> copy(T[] s) {
1617         return s.length == 0 ? null : list(s);
1618      }
1619
1620      private List<String> merge(List<String> old, String[] newValues) {
1621         List<String> x = Utils.listOfSize(newValues.length);
1622         for (String s : newValues) {
1623            if ("NONE".equals(s)) {
1624               if (old != null)
1625                  old.clear();
1626            } else if ("INHERIT".equals(s)) {
1627               if (old != null)
1628                  x.addAll(old);
1629            } else {
1630               x.add(s);
1631            }
1632         }
1633         return x;
1634      }
1635
1636      private List<String> mergeNavLinks(List<String> old, String[] newValues) {
1637         List<String> x = Utils.listOfSize(newValues.length);
1638         for (String s : newValues) {
1639            if ("NONE".equals(s)) {
1640               if (old != null)
1641                  old.clear();
1642            } else if ("INHERIT".equals(s)) {
1643               if (old != null)
1644                  x.addAll(old);
1645            } else if (s.indexOf('[') != -1 && INDEXED_LINK_PATTERN.matcher(s).matches()) {
1646               Matcher lm = INDEXED_LINK_PATTERN.matcher(s);
1647               lm.matches();
1648               String key = lm.group(1);
1649               int index = Math.min(x.size(), Integer.parseInt(lm.group(2)));
1650               String remainder = lm.group(3);
1651               x.add(index, key.isEmpty() ? remainder : key + ":" + remainder);
1652            } else {
1653               x.add(s);
1654            }
1655         }
1656         return x;
1657      }
1658
1659      private static final Pattern INDEXED_LINK_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("(?s)(\\S*)\\[(\\d+)\\]\\:(.*)");
1660   }
1661
1662   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1663   // Instance
1664   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1665
1666   final String[] style, stylesheet, script, navlinks, head, header, nav, aside, footer;
1667   final AsideFloat asideFloat;
1668   final String noResultsMessage;
1669   final boolean nowrap, resolveBodyVars;
1670   final Class<? extends HtmlDocTemplate> template;
1671   final List<Class<? extends HtmlWidget>> widgets;
1672
1673   private final HtmlWidgetMap widgetMap;
1674   private final HtmlWidget[] widgetArray;
1675   private final HtmlDocTemplate templateBean;
1676
1677   private volatile HtmlSchemaDocSerializer schemaSerializer;
1678
1679   /**
1680    * Constructor.
1681    *
1682    * @param builder The builder for this object.
1683    */
1684   public HtmlDocSerializer(Builder builder) {
1685      super(builder);
1686      style = builder.style != null ? toArray(builder.style) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1687      stylesheet = builder.stylesheet != null ? toArray(builder.stylesheet) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1688      script = builder.script != null ? toArray(builder.script) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1689      head = builder.head != null ? toArray(builder.head) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1690      header = builder.header != null ? toArray(builder.header) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1691      nav = builder.nav != null ? toArray(builder.nav) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1692      aside = builder.aside != null ? toArray(builder.aside) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1693      footer = builder.footer != null ? toArray(builder.footer) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1694      navlinks = builder.navlinks != null ? toArray(builder.navlinks) : EMPTY_ARRAY;
1695      asideFloat = builder.asideFloat;
1696      noResultsMessage = builder.noResultsMessage;
1697      nowrap = builder.nowrap;
1698      resolveBodyVars = builder.resolveBodyVars;
1699      template = builder.template;
1700      widgets = builder.widgets == null ? Collections.emptyList() : copyOf(builder.widgets);
1701
1702      templateBean = newInstance(template);
1703      widgetMap = new HtmlWidgetMap();
1704      widgets.stream().map(this::newInstance).forEach(x -> widgetMap.append(x));
1705      widgetArray = Utils.array(widgetMap.values(), HtmlWidget.class);
1706   }
1707
1708   @Override /* Context */
1709   public Builder copy() {
1710      return new Builder(this);
1711   }
1712
1713   @Override /* Context */
1714   public HtmlDocSerializerSession.Builder createSession() {
1715      return HtmlDocSerializerSession.create(this);
1716   }
1717
1718   @Override /* Context */
1719   public HtmlDocSerializerSession getSession() {
1720      return createSession().build();
1721   }
1722
1723   @Override /* XmlSerializer */
1724   public HtmlSerializer getSchemaSerializer() {
1725      if (schemaSerializer == null)
1726         schemaSerializer = HtmlSchemaDocSerializer.create().beanContext(getBeanContext()).build();
1727      return schemaSerializer;
1728   }

1828    */

1830      return nowrap;
1831   }

1877   /**
1878    * HTML widgets.
1879    *
1880    * @see Builder#widgets(Class...)
1881    * @return
1882    *    Widgets defined on this serializers.
1883    */
1884   protected final HtmlWidgetMap getWidgets() {
1885      return widgetMap;
1886   }
1887
1888   /**
1889    * Performs an action on all widgets defined on this serializer.
1890    *
1891    * @param action The action to perform.
1892    * @return This object.
1893    */
1894   protected final HtmlDocSerializer forEachWidget(Consumer<HtmlWidget> action) {
1895      for (HtmlWidget w : widgetArray)
1896         action.accept(w);
1897      return this;
1898   }

1903
1904   private String[] toArray(List<String> x) {
1905      return x.toArray(new String[x.size()]);
1906   }
1907
1908   private <T> T newInstance(Class<T> c) {
1909      try {
1910         return c.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
1911      } catch (Exception e) {
1912         throw asRuntimeException(e);
1913      }
1914   }
1915
1916   @Override /* Context */
1917   protected JsonMap properties() {
1918      return filteredMap()
1919         .append("header", header)
1920         .append("nav", nav)
1921         .append("navlinks", navlinks)
1922         .append("aside", aside)
1923         .append("asideFloat", asideFloat)
1924         .append("footer", footer)
1925         .append("style", style)
1926         .append("head", head)
1927         .append("stylesheet", stylesheet)
1928         .append("nowrap", nowrap)
1929         .append("template", template)
1930         .append("noResultsMessage", noResultsMessage)
1931         .append("widgets", widgets);
1932   }
